result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan M Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Straight Time. Sentence credit of 120 days was granted, if imposed.
Consecutive to: any other current sentence

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended. Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s. No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. No use or possession of any controlled substances without a valid doctor's prescription

Follow any conditions deemed appropriate by Agent. 

Defendant may not enter any bar, tavern, liquor store, or any place that primarily sells alcohol. 

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 26, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Filed by Atty. Griffis requesting a plea and sentencing date as soon as possible.  **Reviewed by Judge Reilly 8/12/22 - Request granted.**
Hearing on September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.

08:39 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jordan M Nelson in court, in custody, with attorney Justin G Griffis.   Alyssa M Jay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Griffis provides an update, he is still waiting on some digital discovery in 22cm749 case but does have an offer as well as all paper discovery.  Atty. Griffis requests another further proceedings date in about 30 days.  No objection from the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).

09:10 AM; Case called for Motion hearing.  Defendant Jordan M Nelson in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is set for hearing on Defense's Motion to Modify Bail.  Atty. Griffis presents arguments; he is asking bail be amended to a signature bond.  State objects and presents statements.  Atty. Griffis presents additional statements.  Court places its findings on the record.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will deny Defense's Motion to Modify Bail; bail will remain as previously set.  Court will also maintain the previously scheduled hearing set for 08/08/2022 at 8:30 AM.
Motion hearing on July 13, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Filed by Atty. Griffis.
Hearing on August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

09:32 AM; Case called for Hearing.  Defendant Jordan M Nelson in court, in custody at WCJ, with attorney Justin G Griffis.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Nikole Kane appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Griffis provides an update, he was just appointed and has paper discovery but is waiting for some digital discovery, which is forthcoming.  Atty. Griffis also just received an offer in 20CM760, but not this matter.  State confirms that an offer in both cases was sent to Atty. Griffis.  Atty. Griffis requests another further proceedings date to review everything with his client.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.  Hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Griffis.
